segment: Although health officials say the risk to the public remains low, there is rising concern, emerging in part from news that the largest producer of fresh eggs in the U.S. reported an outbreak.
U.S. health officials have stressed that the current public health risk is low and that there is no sign that bird flu is spreading person to person.
The impact on wildlife is difficult to measure. loss estimates range as high as 1mn birds.
UK chicken prices measured by the retail price index rose at 21 per cent annually in September, outstripping the rise of 14 per cent for all food groups and 12 per cent for all prices on the measure.

I think the other thing I worry about is that CDC has this sentinel surveillance for influenza-like illness, which is very non-specific, and I am very concerned if we start to see spread of this [H5N1], we are going to see it in people who are immunocompromised like this person [health worker in Missouri], who had structural lung disease is my understanding. That’s [the immunocompromised group] a group that is vulnerable to getting infected with a lot of things.

And I worry there’s going to be delayed diagnosis and delayed detection. In other words, they [immunocompromised people with illness] may not show up in your regular surveillance systems where you’re looking in ERs. And I think this virus, you’ve just got to respect it.
I think the fact that we have delivered now over half a million vaccine doses that is really important.
Do you think at this point the world will ever get an HIV vaccine?
How likely is it that an HIV vaccine will get over the finish line, even if people figure out how to make one?
What worries me is if we don’t have durable individual immunity, which I think you only get from a vaccine.

What worries me is if we don’t have durable individual immunity, which I think you only get from a vaccine. And by durable [immunity] I mean you do not have to have an encounter with a health care system every six months. So I still think that a vaccine is the Holy Grail.
Yes, PrEP works. Yes, PrEP works. But if you don’t take it [PrEP], it [PrEP] don’t work.
Frankly, I think if we could get data showing that women could use event-driven PrEP, oral PrEP, like men do around sex, then I think it would probably work well.
We’re working on a new refresh of our strategic plan.
We’re working on a new refresh of our strategic plan. We haven’t had one [strategic plan] since 2017; I think it [the strategic plan] got derailed by the pandemic.

There’s still work to do, but the Gates Foundation-funded study of the experimental vaccine M72 will be very interesting.

British health officials are preparing plans to deploy lateral flow tests if signs emerge that avian flu has begun to spread from one person to another.

British health officials are preparing plans to deploy lateral flow tests if signs emerge that avian flu has begun to spread from one person to another. The programme [plans] would provide rapid information about the dangers posed by the disease.

The UK Health Security Agency (UKHSA) is also working on blood tests to detect antibodies against the virus and officials will analyse the disease's genetic mutations to reveal data about the increased risk to human health from avian flu.
